Adieu!  my sweet garden, adieu!</br>Adieu to each favourite flow'r!</br>The suckle combin'd with the yew,</br>Constructing simplicity's bow'r.
When oft the cool moments I've pass'd,</br>And sung of the spring-mantl'd year,</br>The Muse for my Emma embrac'd,</br>To friendship and truth ever dear.
The morn's snowy bosom, as fair</br>Is the mind of my charmer confest;</br>Ye gales in my absence declare</br>The whispers of love from my breast.
Adieu to the sweet-blushing rose,</br>The lily as fragrant as white,</br>The berry that bleeds as it blows,</br>To yield more substantial delight.
Adieu to the pleasures of May,</br>Each plant in my garden so fair;</br>The trees that rich blossoms display,</br>And burden with odours the air.
Adieu to fertility's charms,</br>Of nature the fondest delight;</br>Ye powers protect them from harms,</br>The fatal north easterly blight.
Adieu to each picturesque scene,</br>Ye hawthorns so lavish of bloom,</br>Ye shrubs of perpetual green,</br>Enhancing the summer's perfume.
Adieu to the nest in the hedge,</br>Let virtue parental prevail;</br>The younglings in safety shall fledge,</br>And harmony pour o'er the dale.
Farewel to affection so true,</br>My Emma, e'er constant and kind,</br>My heart shall reside still with you,</br>Though I leave you reluctant behind.</br>
